Sentencas: A Mg-doped perovskite oxide La0.7Sr0.3Mn0.8Mg0.2O3-delta ( LSMM) is synthesized and investigated as potential cathode material for NO decomposition.
Titulo: La0.7Sr0.3Mn0.8Mg0.2O3-δ perovskite type oxides for NO decomposition by the use of intermediate temperature solid oxide fuel cells

Sentencas: XRD, TEM, and SEM are carried out to analyze the structure and micromorphology of the perovskite oxide and the cell.
Titulo: La0.7Sr0.3Mn0.8Mg0.2O3-δ perovskite type oxides for NO decomposition by the use of intermediate temperature solid oxide fuel cells

Sentencas: Catalytic activity of LSMM for NO conversion is tested on fixed bed.
Titulo: La0.7Sr0.3Mn0.8Mg0.2O3-δ perovskite type oxides for NO decomposition by the use of intermediate temperature solid oxide fuel cells

Sentencas: The electrochemical impedance spectroscopy ( EIS) is used to evaluate the electrochemical activity of LSMM through symmetric cells.
Titulo: La0.7Sr0.3Mn0.8Mg0.2O3-δ perovskite type oxides for NO decomposition by the use of intermediate temperature solid oxide fuel cells

Sentencas: In order to get insight into the effect of operating temperature and gas composition on the cell performance, the electrolyte-supported fuel cells with LSMM as the cathode are tested.
Titulo: La0.7Sr0.3Mn0.8Mg0.2O3-δ perovskite type oxides for NO decomposition by the use of intermediate temperature solid oxide fuel cells

Sentencas: The cell obtains a maximum power density of 13.06 mW cm(-2) with 0.5% NO in Ar over the cathode and 10% H-2 fed to the anode at 700 degrees C.
Titulo: La0.7Sr0.3Mn0.8Mg0.2O3-δ perovskite type oxides for NO decomposition by the use of intermediate temperature solid oxide fuel cells

Sentencas: The increase of both operating temperature and NO concentration can enhance the maximum power density.
Titulo: La0.7Sr0.3Mn0.8Mg0.2O3-δ perovskite type oxides for NO decomposition by the use of intermediate temperature solid oxide fuel cells
